question_text: In which scenario would a 15000 RPM drive offer negligible performance gain over a 7200 RPM drive?
answer_options: When the OS is installed on the drive
When connected to a USB 3.0 port
correct_answer: When connected to a USB 3.0 port
explanation: A USB 3.0 interface can bottleneck even a 7200 RPM drive; adding more RPMs won’t improve performance beyond the port’s limit.
